subject: Career
title: Negotiating Equity and Stock Options
description: A short lesson to help you apply Negotiating Equity and Stock Options.

hook.text: They offer 10,000 stock options. Sounds exciting until you learn the strike price, vesting, and dilution.

buildup.text: Options give you the right to buy shares at a set price. They're worthless if the company doesn't grow.

discovery.text: Key questions: what's the current valuation, total shares outstanding, and vesting schedule?

twist.text: 10,000 options out of 100 million shares is 0.01%. The number means nothing without context.

climax.text: At startups, negotiate for a percentage, not a number. Percentages resist dilution better.

punchline.text: Options are a bet. Understand the odds first.

quiz.question: What makes stock option grants meaningful?
options: The percentage of total shares, not just the number
